snippet: A load of freight can make its way from Los Angeles to Chicago in 48 hours, then take 30 to get across the city.
abstract: Federal, state, local and industry officials are completing the early stages of a $3.2 billion railroad construction project that aims to improve traffic and decrease delays in Chicago, through which an estimated 1,300 freight and passenger trains pass every day; program will add overpasses, underpasses and 50 miles of new track.
lead_paragraph: A load of freight can make its way from Los Angeles to Chicago in 48 hours, then take 30 to get across the city.

headline.seo: Chicago Train Congestion Slows Whole Country
headline.print_headline: Freight Train Late in Charlotte? Blame Chicago
